hint.text:
Remember that \((x+a)(x+b)=x^2+(a+b)x+ab\)
For example:
\(x^2+13x+36\,\)can be written as \(x^2+(9+4)x+(9)(4)\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2+13x+36=(x+9)(x+4)\)

solution.text:
\(x^2+12x+27\)
Notice that \(x^2+12x+27\,\)can be written as \(x^2+(3+9)x+(3)(9)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2+(3+9)x+(3)(9)=(x+3)(x+9)\)

solution.text:
\(y^2+17y+70\)
Notice that \(y^2+17y+70\,\)can be written as \(y^2+(7+10)y+(7)(10)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow y^2+(7+10)y+(7)(10)=(y+7)(y+10)\)

solution.text:
\(t^2+4t-21\)
Notice that \(t^2+4t-21\,\)can be written as \(t^2+(7-3)t+7(-3)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow t^2+(7-3)t+7(-3)=(t+7)(t-3)\)

solution.text:
\(s^2-4s-117\)
Notice that \(s^2-4s-117\,\)can be written as \(s^2+(9-13)s+9(-13)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow s^2+(9-13)s+9(-13)=(s+9)(s-13)\)

Remember that some algebraic expressions can be factorized using identities. These are some common identities :
\(a^2+2ab+b^2=(a+b)^2\)
\(a^2-2ab+b^2=(a-b)^2\)
\(a^2-b^2=(a+b)(a-b)\)
\(a^3-b^3=(a-b)(a^2+ab+b^2)\)
\(a^3+b^3=(a+b)(a^2-ab+b^2)\)

Try and use the method completing the perfect square
For example :
\(a^2+8a+15\)
\(=a^2+8a+4^2-4^2+15\,\)[Adding and subtracting \(4^2\)]
\(=a^2+(2)(a)(4)+4^2-1\)
\(=(a+4)^2-1\)
Now use the identity \(a^2-b^2=(a-b)(a+b)\)
\(=(a+4-1)(a+4+1)\)
\(=(a+3)(a+5)\)

solution.text:
\((4a+13y)^2-5(4a+13y)+6\)
Let \(x=4a+13y\)
\(=x^2-5x+6\)
Notice that \(x^2-5x+6\,\) can be written as \(x^2+(-2-3)x+(-2)(-3)\)
Using identity \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(=(x-2)(x-3)\)
Now substitute \(x\,\) for \(4a+13y\)
\(=(4a+13y-2)(4a+13y-3)\)
